channel.title: Solved
channel.description: I would like for the command ::players to pop up an interface of all the players online and their level.. How would I do that?

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Search online for those methods.

item.title: Solved
item.dc:creator: @Trade_Me Trade Me
item.description:
@Trade_Me wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:6, topic:444894”]^He didn’t, I removed my previous post.

Oops. My bad, I misread.

	if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players")) {
	    int line = 8147;
	    for (int i = 1; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) {
		Client p = c.getClient(i);
		if (!c.validClient(i)) continue;
		if (p.playerName != null) {
		    c.getPA().sendFrame126("@dre@" + p.playerName, line);
		    line++;
		}
	    }
	    c.getPA().showInterface(8134);
	    c.flushOutStream();
	}

Something like this should work, I wrote it quick & didn’t test.[/quote]

I get the following error whenever I do that…
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:161: error: cannot find symbol
Client p = c.getClient(i);
^
symbol: method getClient(int)
location: variable c of type Client
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:162: error: cannot find symbol
if (!c.validClient(i)) continue;
^
symbol: method validClient(int)
location: variable c of type Client
Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
2 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
